properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 2:59PM PST until January 13 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...NEXT STORM SYSTEM MOVING IN SUNDAY...

.Our next weather system will move in early Sunday bringing heavy
snow to the mountains and valleys above 2000 ft. Breezy
conditions, especially on exposed ridges, will create areas of
blowing snow which could significantly reduce visibility. Plan on
slippery road conditions which will make travel difficult.

* WHAT...heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 16
inches.

* WHERE...Kellogg, Pinehurst, Osburn, Wallace, Mullan, Fourth of
July Pass, Dobson Pass, and Lookout Pass.

* WHEN...from 7 AM Sunday to 10 AM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy
blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM SUNDAY TO 10 AM PST MONDAY
